Key Match Events: Evan Mobley shot 9 for 14 to help Cleveland outscore Toronto 68-38 in the paint.
Cleveland outscored Toronto 20-4 over the final 5:09 of the first half as the Raptors turned the ball over six times.
The Cavs had five dunks in that stretch, three of them from Jarrett Allen.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers play their home opener against Detroit on Friday night.
Toronto hosts former coach Nick Nurse and the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Many in the sellout crowd of 19,800 left early.
The Raptors made 19 turnovers, leading to 30 points for Cleveland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Quickley fell heavily under his own basket when he was fouled in the second quarter. He checked out with 2:24 to go in the first half and did not return. The Raptors said Quickley was ruled out because of a right pelvic contusion.
Others: Chris Boucher scored 18 points off the bench
Immanuel Quickley scored 13 points in 14 minutes before exiting because of an injury
